tr.td: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.Polio.bOPVplusIPV
Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
draft
WHO
computable

div.p: WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

tr.td:
Client is not due for bOPV vaccination: Client is not due for bOPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
For all countries using OPV in their national immunization programme, WHO recommends 3 doses of bOPV and 2 doses of IPV. The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses. The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with the third dose of the diphtheria–tetanus–pertussis vaccine [DTP3] or pentavalent vaccine [penta3]), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).
Note: Based on local epidemiology, programmatic implications and feasibility of delivery, countries may choose an alternative “early IPV schedule” starting with the first IPV dose at 6 weeks of age (with DTP1/penta1) and the second IPV dose at 14 weeks (with DTP3/penta3).
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for bOPV vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)

Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first bOPV dose as client's age is less than 6 weeks. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first bOPV dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

Client is due for bOPV vaccination: Client is due for bOPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "bOPV")
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for bOPV vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)

Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first bOPV dose as no poliovirus doses were administered and client's age is between 6 weeks and 3 months. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

Client is due for bOPV and IPV vaccination: Client is due for bOPV and IPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "bOPV") AND (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "IPV")
For infants late in starting the routine immunization schedule (age > 3 months,) the first IPV dose should be administered at the first immunization contact along with bOPV and the other routinely recommended vaccines. Doses for those who start vaccination late: 5 doses (IPV to be given with first dose and third dose of bOPV).
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for bOPV and IPV vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)

Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first bOPV dose and first IPV dose as client's age is more than 3 months and no poliovirus doses were administered. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

Client is not due for polio vaccination: Client is not due for polio vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
For all countries using OPV in their national immunization programme, WHO recommends 3 doses of bOPV and 2 doses of IPV. The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses. The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with DTP3/penta3), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).
Note: Based on local epidemiology, programmatic implications and feasibility of delivery, countries may choose an alternative “early IPV schedule” starting with the first IPV dose at 6 weeks of age (with DTP1/penta1), and the second IPV dose at 14 weeks (with DTP3/penta3).

priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

citation.value: WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

title.value: Client is not due for bOPV vaccination

description.value:
Client is not due for bOPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
For all countries using OPV in their national immunization programme, WHO recommends 3 doses of bOPV and 2 doses of IPV. The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses. The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with the third dose of the diphtheria–tetanus–pertussis vaccine [DTP3] or pentavalent vaccine [penta3]), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).
Note: Based on local epidemiology, programmatic implications and feasibility of delivery, countries may choose an alternative “early IPV schedule” starting with the first IPV dose at 6 weeks of age (with DTP1/penta1) and the second IPV dose at 14 weeks (with DTP3/penta3).
Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.value: Should not vaccinate client with first bOPV dose as client's age is less than 6 weeks. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first bOPV dose.

title.value: Client is due for bOPV vaccination

description.value: Client is due for bOPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "bOPV")
Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.value: Should vaccinate client with first bOPV dose as no poliovirus doses were administered and client's age is between 6 weeks and 3 months. Check for contraindications.

title.value: Client is due for bOPV and IPV vaccination

description.value:
Client is due for bOPV and IPV vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "bOPV") AND (where "Type of poliovirus dose" = "IPV")
For infants late in starting the routine immunization schedule (age > 3 months,) the first IPV dose should be administered at the first immunization contact along with bOPV and the other routinely recommended vaccines. Doses for those who start vaccination late: 5 doses (IPV to be given with first dose and third dose of bOPV).
Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.value: Should vaccinate client with first bOPV dose and first IPV dose as client's age is more than 3 months and no poliovirus doses were administered. Check for contraindications.

title.value: Client is not due for polio vaccination

description.value:
Client is not due for polio vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
For all countries using OPV in their national immunization programme, WHO recommends 3 doses of bOPV and 2 doses of IPV. The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4 week-interval between doses. The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with DTP3/penta3), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).
Note: Based on local epidemiology, programmatic implications and feasibility of delivery, countries may choose an alternative “early IPV schedule” starting with the first IPV dose at 6 weeks of age (with DTP1/penta1), and the second IPV dose at 14 weeks (with DTP3/penta3).
Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.value: Should not vaccinate client with poliovirus dose as the latest bOPV dose was administered less than 4 weeks ago. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the next poliovirus dose.

expression.value: Should vaccinate client with second bOPV dose as the latest bOPV dose was administered more than 4 weeks ago. Check for contraindications

The preferred schedule is to administer the 3 doses of bOPV starting from the minimum age of 6 weeks, with at least a 4-week interval between doses. The first IPV dose should be administered from a minimum of 14 weeks of age (with DTP3/penta3), with the second IPV dose being given at least 4 months later (possibly coinciding with other vaccines administered at 9 months of age).
Communicate guidance to the health worker
